title: HolyRoses iPod 5g 5.5g iTunes sync fix
description:
Documentation and files necessary to let my iPod videos that are not 320x240 width sync using iTunes for iPod 5g and 5.5g.

----------------------------------------------

Here is a solution for iPod 5g or 5.5g owners to get all my iPod compatible releases to play on your iPod.

I have provided the necessary files in this torrent, but if you want to download the originals go ahead.

I have also compiled AtomicParsley for linux to save you the trouble.  To use the linux binary extract the compressed tar file and copy atomicparsley/trunk/atomicparsley/AtomicParsley to /usr/local/bin or someplace else in your path.

If you run all my uploads that have iPod in the title through another conversion process they will sync from iTunes. You don't need to do this for my iPod 320x240 vids.

For Windows solution:

download and extract this: <a href="
http://nic.dnsalias.com/NicMP4Box.zip" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://nic.dnsalias.com/NicMP4Box.zip</a>

and then run the following from command line:
NicMP4Box -add "original.m4v" "new.m4v"

------------------

For Linux solution:

Download and compile the SVN version of AtomicParsley <a href="
http://sourceforge.net/svn/?group_id=153768" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://sourceforge.net/svn/?group_id=153768</a>

Then use the following syntax (this runs very fast):
AtomicParsley Filename.m4v --DeepScan --iPod-uuid 1200 --overWrite
   (if you dont wish to overWrite the file then use)
AtomicParsley Filename.m4v --DeepScan --iPod-uuid 1200 --output Newfile.m4v


I tested both the NicMP4Box and the AtomicParsley solution and both worked for my iPod 5 and 5.5G.

I researched this before and the version of MP4Box I use in linux doesn't add this special uuid and my tests didn't work. I'll be adding this UUID to my future iPod uploads.

Thanks for pushing me to find a resolution VoV.

-HR

----------------- ADDITIONAL information ------------------------------

found it!

To fix this problem on windows using AtomicParsley go here: <a href="
http://apaseltiner.googlepages.com/Tagger.zip" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://apaseltiner.googlepages.com/Tagger.zip</a>

download his package.  The AtomicParsley-utf8.exe supports the proper iPod atom.

Then just run:
AtomicParsley-utf8.exe orginal.m4v --DeepScan --iPod-uuid 1200 --output new.m4v

or you can use the --overWrite option instead of --output new.m4v

AtomicParsley is much faster than NicMP4Box.
